message: @ptone It did. It was very code-centric and moved quickly, so the convore topic wasn't very active.
Anyone know of some good posts/presentations to soak in if I want to use the mock library with my Django app's tests (effectively)?
You can add http://www.mattjmorrison.com/blog/mocking-django to your list
Yeah I was inspired to start using it after that talk and this one http://us.pycon.org/2011/schedule/presentations/172/
also my mock reference links: http://pinboard.in/u:ptone/t:mock/

for me, initial hangup was I was trying to mock the object, and assign method to mock object.  Whereas if you want to mock a method, remember that a method *IS* an object in python, and mock that directly
I put a few mock tests in https://github.com/cartwheelweb/django-la-facebook
also watch this space for a video link hopefully soon (though I saw no discussion of this talk on Convore, did it happen?) http://us.pycon.org/2011/schedule/presentations/34/
+1 especially if we can bundle it with some good how-to doc to encourage folks to use it in a way that a.) makes their tests faster b.) doesn't make them too brittle
Russ and me been discussing adding mock to Django in the next release, what do people think about that?
yeah, it'd definitely require sensible documentation to go with it
As soon as I learn how to sensibly use mock, I'd be willing to help document it :-)
